preqs: Students must have passed one of the following units ETX1100, ETF1100, ETX9000, ETF5900, ETX5900, BFF5951 or AFX9510 or have permission from the unit coordinator.

rules.ruleString: Incompatible with achievement in (I/W) {ETB2111, ETC1010, ETF2121, ETF9121, ETW2111, ETX2111, ETX2121}
For COURSE_CODE NOT IN {3814, 3815, 3816, 3822} Do Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {AFX9510, ETX1100, ETX5900, ETX9000} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS} Otherwise true
Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {AFX9510, BFF5951, ETF5900, ETX1100, ETX5900, ETX9000} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS}

description: This unit will introduce statistical concepts and their applications to business sectors of finance, accounting, marketing and management. Topics covered include: sampling techniques, confidence intervals and hypothesis testing (for both single populations and between populations). The multiple regression models and time series models -- that are very popular in data analysis and forecasting in public sectors and industries -- will be covered in detail in this unit. Prerequisites ETX1100, BFF5951 or AFX9510 will not apply to students who enrol in the Graduate Diploma in Applied Econometrics.
